title.bibl: Illinois Staats-Zeitung, October 20, 1891. The Democrats Nominate Three Jews.

div.bibl: Illinois Staats-Zeitung, October 20, 1891. THE DEMOCRATS NOMINATE THREE JEWS.

body.p: The Israelites have had frequent opportunities during the last few years to reveal their strength and their political influence. Seldom do they appear upon the political arena as a whole, but are to be found usually, on both sides of the battle-line.

This, of course, occasioned the question among them, why the Republicans never concede a representative to them; although the Democrats have for the third time recognized their importance by nominating three of their people, Mannheimer, Cahn, and H. Gelder. The election of Gelder is recommended by many Israelite clubs, especially on the Southwest Side.
